The aftermath left the inner worlds cracked open with their cores exposed to radiation which formed materials which were mined during the late days of the Galactic Republic and the era of the Galactic Empire. The MC80 Star Cruiser Aurora Flare stopped at the Redhurne System around 1 ABY. In 3 ABY, the Rebel Alliance's 61st Mobile Infantry raided an Imperial heavy freighter in the system, seizing supplies for a damaged hyperdrive.

The Redhurne system was a star system orbiting a star located in the Mid Rim region of the galaxy. The worlds among the system were left devastated when the star had a supernova, becoming devoid of life. Radiation from the post-nova star formed the building blocks of hypermatter in the exposed cores of the nearest worlds.

Centuries prior to the Galactic Civil War, the sun of the Redhurne system had a supernova, which burned the other worlds and cracking open those closer to the star. The post-nova star transmitted radiation which transmuted materials within the broken planets that formed the building blocks of hypermatter. During the final days of the Galactic Republic, stations operated by skeleton crews collected these materials using scavenging drones. After the Galactic Empire took the Republic's place, they continued to use the stations.

Around the year 1 ABY, the Aurora Flare, an MC80 Star Cruiser, stopped in the Redhurne system before traveling to Mon Cala with a load of coaxium. In 3 ABY, the Rebel Alliance's 61st Mobile Infantry, better known as Twilight Company, boarded an Imperial heavy freighter in the Redhurne system to obtain supplies to repair the hyperdrive of their CR90 corvette, the Thunderstrike. The raid lured in the support of an Imperial Gozanti-class cruiser which forced the rebels to hasten their withdrawal from the heavy freighter. The Thunderstrike and its escort, the Braha'tok-class gunship Apailana's Promise ultimately escaped with the supplies.
The Redhurne system first appeared in the 2015 novel Battlefront: Twilight Company, written by Alexander Freed.
